intro.text: Welcome to IMS Software documentation. IMS is a cutting-edge Integrated Management System designed for enterprise workflow automation and reporting.

sections.title: Chapter 1: Installation and Setup
sections.summary: This chapter covers detailed installation instructions, initial configuration, and system requirements for IMS Software.

content.text: To install IMS, ensure your system meets the minimum requirements: Windows 10 or higher, 8GB RAM, 50GB free disk space, and .NET Framework 4.8. Begin by downloading the installer from the official website.
After running the installer, follow the on-screen instructions. You can choose between a Typical or Custom setup. Custom setup allows you to configure the database connection and network options.

items: Verify that SQL Server is installed and accessible.
Configure firewall rules to allow IMS network traffic.
Create an admin account during setup.

content.text: If you encounter errors during installation, check your system logs located in %APPDATA%/IMS/logs for detailed error messages.
Common issues include missing prerequisites or insufficient permissions. Running the installer as Administrator often resolves permission issues.
After installation, configure IMS using the Setup Wizard or edit the config file located at C:\ProgramData\IMS\config.json.
Ensure you restart the IMS service after making changes.

sections.title: Chapter 2: User Management and Roles
sections.summary: This chapter explains user account management, role definitions, and permissions within IMS Software.

content.text: IMS provides a flexible user management system. Administrators can create users, assign roles, and manage permissions through the Admin Console.
Roles include Admin, Manager, and Viewer, each with different access levels. The system supports custom roles with granular permission control.

items: Click 'Add User' and fill in details.

content.text: IMS implements RBAC to ensure secure access. Permissions are grouped into roles for simplified management.
